entry.title: [Android] Fix flakiness when loading url PopupPTTest
entry.content:
popup_test.html opens popups immediately, and the state expected by

ChromeActivityTestRule#loadUrl() isn't reached on the same page,

though it is reached on the popups.



Using the async call Tab#loadUrl() instead allows us to wait only the

the popup page and is more correct with the design of Public Transit.

entry.title: Reland "[pdf-a11y]: enable tree consistency checks for plugin tree"
entry.content:
This change relands

https://crrev.com/c/5323727



with additions:

- AXNodeObject::AddChildrenImpl which recomputes children if needed, now

checks if it is an embed. If so, it resets the plugin serializer.



- AXNodeObject::Detach, similarly, checks if it is an embed. If so, it

also resets the plugin serializer.



This should capture the lifetime of the embed and its children (creation

and deletion).



This fixes issues where the embed was clearing its children, resulting

in mismatches in the plugin serializer with the blink serializer



Bug: 326733014, 327493665, 326131114

Test: cq and specific stress tests in the bugs

entry.title: [bookmarks] Add metric to log whether IDs are reassigned during startup
entry.content:
The new metric is recorded for each of the two files being loaded.



The precise instrumentation in ModelLoader is somewhat complex, as the

code gets exercised quite differently on iOS, at least for the case

where feature `syncer::kEnableBookmarkFoldersForAccountStorage` is

disabled: when to BookmarkModel instances exist, it also means two

ModelLoader instances exist, which requires that ModelLoader is aware

of whether or not it is in the process of loading the account

bookmarks JSON file as local-or-syncable bookmarks. This notion already

exists in BookmarkModel, so it only requires injecting a boolean in

ModelLoader's constructor.

entry.title: Fix premature binding of PasswordManaderDriver.
entry.content:
Currently, PasswordManagerDriver binding has RenderFrameHost lifetime,

not document lifetime. This can lead to premature binding in rare race

conditions: See https://crbug.com/329989911



Due to this, we can't reliably determine if the document will be

credentialless at this stage, because the browser process doesn't know

about it yet.



This patches handles the `kPendingCommit` case.

entry.title: Rewrite and deflake response-interception-cancel-xhr-while-responding-error.js
entry.content:
The presumed reason for flakeyness is the fact that the test expected abortion of a network request to get propagated from renderer to the InterceptionJob before the cancellation of network request is detected by the test via the renderer. This is not guaranteed, since URLLoader is using its own asynchronous mojo pipe and closure of the pipe may not be properly reflected on the browser side when we follow up with continue command.



We now fall back to polling browser side with a command that would produce different errors depending on whether the job is still active.



Also, the test has been simplified and rewritten in terms of the Fetch domain.



Bug: 41489920

Change-Id: I1d6116cfd27a8ecca52258b86f37e2d663073b3d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5389567

Reviewed-by: Alex Rudenko

in the start-up process, and must be done after the GpuServiceImpl is

default 'EnableADPFGpuCompositorThread' feature, to enable measurement

of the impact on field metrics.

entry.title: Adjust GLTextureImageBacking scanout/upload usage
entry.content:
GLTextureImageBacking wasn't used for shared memory GMBs, aka when it

had SHARED_IMAGE_USAGE_CPU_UPLOAD on Android. This isn't a real

limitation it's just that shared memory GMBs are only used on Android

for one-copy raster and SharedMemoryImageBacking is used for that case.

Remove the limitation but make sure that GLTextureImageBacking rejects

SHARED_IMAGE_USAGE_SCANOUT on Android always since it's not

grandfathered into allowing it. Also start rejecting scanout usage on

Mac since IOSurfaceImageBacking actually support it and should always be

available.



Bug: 330865436

entry.title: [UPM] Clear BuiltInBackend inside PasswordStoreProxyBackend
entry.content:
This CL potentially clears BuiltInBackend when

PasswordStoreProxyBackend::OnSyncServiceInitialized is called.

Passwords are cleared to avoid regressing existing UPM users where

GMSCore version supports obtaining passwords only from an account.

Passwords are cleared only

if:

* password syncing is enabled

* user finished initial UPM migration and wasn't unenrolled from UPM

* kUnifiedPasswordManagerSyncOnlyInGMSCore feature is enabled

entry.title: Avoid overflows in MP4 epoch calculations
entry.content:
UBSan caught an issue here:

https://luci-milo.appspot.com/ui/inv/build-8752555092756764593/test-results?q=Mp4MuxerBoxWriterTest.Mp4MovieExtends&sortby=&groupby=



Keep the calculation in base::Time and base::TimeDelta, which internally

use saturation arithmetic. Also rather than convert to the Windows

epoch, then the MP4 epoch, just compute the MP4 epoch as a base::Time at

compile time, and then do just one subtraction to get a TimeDelta. From

there, convert to uint64_t seconds, saturated.



While I'm here, constants in headers should use C++17 inline variables

to avoid ODR problems.



Bug: 40942951

Change-Id: I9762957279200e336fbc40a268fba85dc6e6f191

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5390904

Auto-Submit: David Benjamin

entry.title: Use `in_forced_colors` web setting in Blink
entry.content:
This CL uses the `in_forced_colors` web setting introduced in

CL:5324688 within Blink. The web setting was introduced to remove the

reliance on the global NativeTheme web instance for the state of forced

colors in Blink.



More specifically, this change:

1.) replaces all calls to the WebThemeEngine::GetForcedColors with the

web setting

2.) copies the setting in components that require it such as svg_image

and web_page_popup

3.) updates the kForcedHighContrast switch to override the web setting

for the content shell and web tests



Bug: 1231644, 41489514

entry.title: ui/gfx/native_pixmap: Make ExportHandle() const
entry.content:
This modifies NativePixmap::ExportHandle() to be const. This required

changing the implementations to also be const. Making this change lets

a const NativePixmap export a NativePixmapHandle.



No implementations of ExportHandle() required the method to be

non-const, so there are no changes to the actual implementations other

than changing the method declarations to be const.

entry.title: [Cookie] Record source
entry.content:
Let's record the source of a cookie so that we can track if it's from:

(1) Unknown - tests or cookies set before this field was added

(2) HTTP - cookies set via HTTP header

(3) Script - cookies set via document.cookie

(4) Other - cookies set via browser login, iOS, WebView APIs,

Extension APIs, or DevTools



There's a TODO to assert (at storage time) when a cookie has a source

in a non-test context that is Unknown. I don't want to do that in this

CL because (1) we aren't depending on this to do anything yet and (2) I don't want to be rolling back a CL this large if the Check uncovers an

issue that needs to be fixed.



Bug: 1482799

entry.title: Cookie Controls: Change reload method
entry.content:
Changes the method of reloading the page after a user has changed 3PC

blocking to the standard reload pathway. Previously a reload was

achieved by marking a reload as required.



It appears that the previously used pathway resulted in some sites not

correctly re-detecting that their cookie access had changed.



The updated pathway will prompt the user if the reload would resend post

data (similarly to the reload button). This will not prevent the cookie

controls reload animation from playing however, but given there is a

timeout that automatically closes it, this should be ok.



Bug: 330093336

Change-Id: I14970bcff674be9f4ddb9663e8761ce6e06fed64

Reviewed-by: Fiona Macintosh

entry.title: [iOS] Fix can't select KA's "Suggest Password" button with Voice Control
entry.content:
The keyboard accessory (KA) suggestions (including the "Suggest

Password" button) are all lined up inside a horizontally scrollable

view. Therefore, to facilitate the discovery of these suggestions, their

accessibility label contained a "X of Y" part to indicate that a given

suggestion was the Xth option out of Y options. This worked well with

VoiceOver, but posed a problem with Voice Control as the visual text of

a given suggestion wasn't enough to match the item (user had to also

mention the "X of Y" part).



To fix the issue, this CL moves the "X of Y" part from the

suggestions' accessibility label to their accessibility value. That

way the "X of Y" is still read with VoiceOver, but not needed to

select a suggestion with Voice Control.



Before/After comparison:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/9C6yQuS3DF3o2tw.png



Fixed: 41481296

Change-Id: Ie396ab36aeeed028e8c8e84ff049c6683ce91c41

entry.title: Replace use of otool in bling test runner with -enumerate-tests
entry.content:
Doc: go/replace-otool-with-enum-tests



This CL was originally reviewed as a set of stacked changes, with the base here:

https://crrev.com/c/5279816

In the interest of simplifying the revert process, should anything go wrong when it starts taking effect on the main CQ, I've condensed all 4 of those CLs into this one.



This CL replaces otool with the new xcodebuild -enumerate-tests CLI. otool was previously being used from |Runner.resolve_test_cases| to list the EG tests present in the test app binary. That is now being accomplished when initializing either a SimulatorParallelTestRunner or DeviceXcodeTestRunner in the functions:

|SimulatorParallelTestRunner.fetch_test_names| and |SimulatorParallelTestRunner.resolve_test_cases|.



|Runner.resolve_test_cases| was also previously handling filtering non-EG tests based on arguments passed to the test runner, like --gtest_filter. That work is now being done when parsing CLI args.



Disabled tests also required special handling. Outputting disabled tests is one thing that otool had an easier time with than -enumerate-tests. In chromium we disable tests by prefixing the test method name with "DISABLED_" rather than doing things the "Apple approved" way of marking the test as disabled through Xcode which I think would store that information in the .xcodeproj file or a scheme. This means that -enumerate-tests can't find the disabled tests. To work around this limitation I've applied the same logic that we use for running only FLAKY_ prefixed test methods. This finds all disabled tests present in the test app binary, so in the case that the test suite is run across multiple swarming shards we should only bothering outputting them on the first shard.



The CL also contains a few refactors that are not necessarily related to replacing otool, but felt like clear improvements and touched related code.

- consolidating the 3 duplicate _xctest_path functions from test_apps.py into xcode_util.xctest_path

- more clearly checking for the condition which raises ExcessShardsError and improving the exception message

- adds python typing hints to a few new/updated functions



Bug: 326957933,1480192,982435,1077277

Change-Id: If2e63376a6935cd8c4f0245bb814103319a75f07

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5386304

Commit-Queue: Will Yeager

Reviewed-by: Zhaoyang Li

Reviewed-by: Yue She

Reviewed-by: Lindsay Pasricha

entry.title: Add list of PerfettoSQL Chrome Stdlib testsuites
entry.content:
The new file containing the list of Chrome Stdlib diff test testsuites

will be used by the Perfetto diff test runner to run the chrome stdlib

test suites. Having this list ensures that we run the same tests on the

Chromium side and Perfetto side. This also allows us to add new test

suites in Chromium with a single patch, rather than having to modify the runner list in Perfetto separately.

entry.title: [iOSKAUpgrade] Simplify manual fill cell horizontal constraints
entry.content:
This CL creates and uses a layout guide to simplify and generalize the

process of creating horizontal constraints for the manual fill cells'

content. Some of the constraints where based on a `grayLine`, which

won't always be present in the Keyboard Accessory Upgrade UI. Removing

the gray line dependency for constraints will make building the Keyboard

Accessory Upgrade UI easier.



This change doesn't have any visual change.



Note: A follow-up CL will make similar changes for the vertical

constraints.

entry.title: Revert "Reland "Posting registerLocaleChangeReceiver to BG thread""
entry.content:
This reverts commit 5596f56566a9db2f8c9385fad8833510144ef007.



Reason for revert: Introduced a dev-blocking regression described in b/330905807.

Original change's description:

> Reland "Posting registerLocaleChangeReceiver to BG thread"

>

> This is a reland of commit 872620ee34e127b714c3f59a05774f665042b2f7

>

> In this reland, we post registerReceiver calls to a sequencedTaskRunner and the unregister call to the sequencedTaskRunner. Serializing these calls should ensure the register calls occur before the unregister call.

>

> Original change's description:

> > Posting registerLocaleChangeReceiver to BG thread

> >

> > This is in an effort to move as many calls to

> > ContextUtils#registerProtectedBroadcastReceiver off of the UIThread.

> > This is part of an effort to improve runtime performance by reducing

> > the number of IActivityManager binder transactions in the UIThread.

> >

> > Bug: b:325352920

> > Change-Id: I61ea80fbaa26929d96aaf5673ae7d467c0412b56

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5366686

> > Reviewed-by: David Tseng

> > Commit-Queue: Adam Walls

> > Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1271847}

>

> Bug: b:325352920

> Change-Id: I8556492c16d18788812143d9256db1e05dd294bb

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5367078

> Commit-Queue: Mark Schillaci

> Reviewed-by: Mark Schillaci

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1276329}



Bug: b:325352920

Change-Id: I93cad843e7f1edd446887a30c4f9cea04c67f8fb

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5388916

Commit-Queue: David Tseng

entry.title: Clean up kReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos in sync-the-feature tests
entry.content:
These are tests that actually require the user to be in the legacy

syncing state. Before this CL they achieved that by disabling

kReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos and invoking signinWithFakeIdentity.



Now they do so by invoking a new signinAndEnableLegacySyncFeature. The

flag override can then go away.

entry.title: Cleanup: Merge DataTypeController into ModelTypeController
entry.content:
DataTypeController was the (abstract) base class of

ModelTypeController.

In the past, there were multiple implementations of

DataTypeController, but that's no longer the case, so the split of

Data.. vs Model.. was no longer necessary.



This CL merges DataTypeController into ModelTypeController.

"DataTypeController" still exists as an alias, so that all the (many)

references to it can be cleaned up separately in followup CLs.



Bug: 41487792

entry.title: Remove the '_' hack to remove variant names from filename
entry.content:
For some variants, we do not want to automatically insert the variant

names in the generated filename. This used to be done by prefixing the

variant names with '_'. Later, an 'append_variants_to_name' param was

added. This is cleaner and more explicit and we should get rid of the

'_' hack in favor of this new param.



Bug: 330885075

entry.title: Use a single consistent case and format for the canvas_types param
entry.content:
The YAML configs and the Jinja templates were using different case for

the canvas_type[s] param. For instance, we had to do:

canvasType: [HtmlCanvas]

code: {{ if canvas_type == 'htmlcanvas' ... }}



The format is now:

canvas_types: [HtmlCanvas]

code: {{ if canvas_type == 'HtmlCanvas' ... }}



Bug: 330885075

Change-Id: I208d5c07381f88606d6d2936aa98753910f061d5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5377005

Commit-Queue: Jean-Philippe Gravel

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1277611}

entry.title: Merge variants: and variant_matrix: in WPT's Canvas test generator
entry.content:
The "variants" key is essentially just a one dimensional variant

matrix. Since the syntax for variant matrix is so light weight, using

variant matrices everywhere isn't adding too much complexity in the

YAML files. It's however simplifying the test generator, which will

help for future changes as we add more features around variant

support.



Bug: 330885075

entry.title: Revert "Kiosk heartbeats: Set initial delay to zero"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 84f86697a4d9cf5177fd4ab067b8ab4566d81987.



Reason for revert: KioskHeartbeatEventsBrowserTest.ReportKioskHeartbeats is consistently failing on CrOS since this CL merged (https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chrome/clusters/reason-v6/94957cdcb6079b7d45ea3d8459706ca0?selectedMetrics=human-cls-failed-presubmit%2Ccritical-failures-exonerated%2Cfailures&historyTimeRange=30d&annotated=false)



Original change's description:

> Kiosk heartbeats: Set initial delay to zero

>

> Remove the initial delay for kiosk heartbeats so they are send as soon as possible.

>

entry.title: Fix google.patch in third_party/hunspell
entry.content:
While working on the bdict parser, I noticed that the patch didn't

apply. Or rather, it did apply but silently threw away some data because

the patch got corrupted at some point! (The header lines have the wrong

line count.)



The problem seems to date to https://crrev.com/c/702640, which

hand-edited the patch but got it wrong. The + and - were backwards

and, by merging two chunks together, the line headers needed to be

updated.



We also forgot to update src/hunspell/utf_info.cxx the last time we

updated hunspell. Upstream reformatted the file and added license

headers.



I've reconciled this by recreating the patch from scratch:



1. Clone hunspell from git at v1.6.0

2. Copy upstream's latest src/hunspell/utf_info.cxx into Chromium

3. Replace hunspell files with what's in the Chromium source tree

4. Recreate the diff to match what Chromium actually has checked in

5. Inspect the diff of the diff to confirm nothing went awry



Change-Id: Ied45a25804f91677b3f44827ba784ecd8c59e736

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5389746

Auto-Submit: David Benjamin

Commit-Queue: David Benjamin

Reviewed-by: David Roger

entry.title: [test] Suppress all stack trace output in death tests
entry.content:
In https://crrev.com/1276095 we suppressed the generation of ordinary

stack traces (and therefore their emssion) in death tests. As luck would

have it, TaskTrace generates a faux StackTrace and prints it.



In this CL, we suppress emission of non-empty StackTrace instances in

death tests so that TaskTraces in CHECK log messages in death tests that

fire as the result of a posted task do not slow down, and therefore

cause flakes in, these tests.



Bug: 41490321

entry.title: Specify the underlying type for UMALinuxGlibcVersion
entry.content:
enums are weird. They are neither limited to their listed values, but

nor are they plain ints. If an enum is neither `enum class ...` nor

`enum Foo : T`, its "underlying type" is not "fixed". In that case,

although it is typically sized like an int, the range of values is

defined by some bizarre "hypothetical integer type with minimal width"

rule.

https://eel.is/c++draft/dcl.dcl#dcl.enum-8



RecordLinuxGlibcVersion() specifically wants to store the full range of

uint32_t in the enum, so just specify an underlying type of uint32_t.

This fixes one of the two UBSan errors in this (and several other) test

failures:

https://luci-milo.appspot.com/ui/inv/build-8752555092756764593/test-results?q=All%2FAboutFlagsBrowserTest.ExpiryHidesFlag%2F0&sortby=&groupby=



Bug: 40942951

Change-Id: Ic4c9d41d64be4a7e1fae53792a78a6469a07bc57

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5390905

Reviewed-by: Erik Chen

Auto-Submit: David Benjamin

Commit-Queue: David Benjamin

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1277593}

entry.title: Simplify path management with a better _OutputPath abstraction
entry.content:
There is no need to keep a separate image_out_dir since images are

always written to the same path as the tests. Things are much simpler

if we use an _OutputPath class to stores both the element and the

offscreen paths. We can then call sub_path(...) on an _OutputPath

to create a sub-path for both element and offscreen.

entry.title: [css-anchor-position] Update position-anchor in AnchorEvaluator
entry.content:
The AnchorEvaluator initially gets the position-anchor from the previous

style resolution set, but never modified it, which meant the anchor

functions would never pick up any position-anchor changes from

@position-try rules.



Make position-anchor a high priority property and update the

AnchorEvaluator with the position-anchor name before resolving any

anchor functions.



Bug: 329584105

entry.title: Store PlusProfiles in PlusAddressService
entry.content:
PlusAddressService currently only stores (origin, plus_address) pairs,

ignoring PlusProfile::profile_id. As a result, PlusAddressService::

GetPlusProfiles(), which returns a std::vector returns

incompletely initialized PlusProfiles (profile_ids missing).



This CL fixes this by instead storing the PlusProfiles themselves, as

they are received from the database.



In case sync integration is disabled, the database is not used and the

profile_ids are not available through the RPC to the backend. In those

cases, the profile_ids remain 0.



Bug: b/322147254

Change-Id: I4e953aed5f1e4820fc131027cb2aad37db63afe4
